Class LoginBoundary.Session

java.lang.Object
boundary.LoginBoundary.Session
Enclosing class:
LoginBoundary
public static class LoginBoundary.Session extends Object
Represents an active authenticated session for a single user in the system. This immutable class holds the authenticated user's information and provides convenient access to user details. Exactly one actor type (student, rep, or staff) is non-null, determined by the LoginBoundary.Role.

Session objects are used to:

  • Route users to appropriate role-specific interfaces
  • Provide user context for authorization checks
  • Display user information in the UI
  • Track active user sessions
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Session

      public Session(LoginBoundary.Role role, Student student, CompanyRep rep, CareerCenterStaff staff)
      Constructs a session with the authenticated user details. Exactly one of the user type parameters should be non-null, corresponding to the role.
      Parameters:
      role - user role determining which actor field should be non-null
      student - student user (non-null only if role is STUDENT)
      rep - company representative (non-null only if role is COMPANY_REP)
      staff - career center staff member (non-null only if role is STAFF)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role and user type parameters are inconsistent

  • Method Details

    • getUserDisplayName

      public String getUserDisplayName()
      Gets the user's display name for UI presentation. Returns the full name of the authenticated user or a fallback message if the user entity is unexpectedly null.
      Returns:
      the user's display name, or "Unknown [Role]" if user not found

    • getUserId

      public String getUserId()
      Gets the user's unique identifier for system operations. Returns the appropriate ID based on user role:
      • Students: student ID
      • Company Representatives: email address
      • Staff: staff ID
      Returns:
      the user's ID/email, or null if role is unknown or user entity is null

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the session for debugging and logging.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      session details including role and user display name
